The word إِلَيْهِمْ comes from the root ا ل ي and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to hasten forward, go along fearfully in looking fixedly at a point. ahta'a - to walk fast while stretching the neck (camel).
data.sentence: The word مُهْطِعِينَ comes from the root ه ط ع and is associated with the meanings: to hasten forward, go along fearfully in looking fixedly at a point. ahta'a - to walk fast while stretching the neck (camel).

data.meanings: to be content, satisfied with what is within one's approach, not looking for more, beg with some reservation, beseech earnestly. qani'un (pl. qunna'un) - one who is deserving charity but does not beg, content. muqni'un (vb. 4) - one who lifts up the head. aqna'a - to raise (the head), outstretched neck.
data.sentence: The word مُقْنِعِي comes from the root ق ن ع and is associated with the meanings: to be content, satisfied with what is within one's approach, not looking for more, beg with some reservation, beseech earnestly. qani'un (pl. qunna'un) - one who is deserving charity but does not beg, content. muqni'un (vb. 4) - one who lifts up the head. aqna'a - to raise (the head), outstretched neck.

data.meanings: head, head/chief/commander/ruler/governor/prince, strike on the head, set any one over, become high in rank/condition, highest or uppermost part, the capital/principal of money, the beginning or first part, numerous and strong company of people.
data.sentence: The word رُءُوسِهِمْ comes from the root ر ا س and is associated with the meanings: head, head/chief/commander/ruler/governor/prince, strike on the head, set any one over, become high in rank/condition, highest or uppermost part, the capital/principal of money, the beginning or first part, numerous and strong company of people.

data.meanings: to send back, turn back, reject, refuse, repel, revert, restore, give back, refer, give again, take again, repeat, retrace. maraddun - place where one returns. mardud - restored, averted. irtadda (vb. 8) - to return, turn again, be rendered. taradda (vb. 5) - to be agitated, move to and fro.
data.sentence: The word يَرْتَدُّ comes from the root ر د د and is associated with the meanings: to send back, turn back, reject, refuse, repel, revert, restore, give back, refer, give again, take again, repeat, retrace. maraddun - place where one returns. mardud - restored, averted. irtadda (vb. 8) - to return, turn again, be rendered. taradda (vb. 5) - to be agitated, move to and fro.
The word طَرْفُهُمْ comes from the root ط ر ف and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to hurt in the heart, be affected with heart disease, be struck in the heart. Motion, putting in motion When said of fuel; It burned, burned up, burned brightly or fiercely, blazed, or flamed: and so when said of the heart; It became excited with ardour, or eagerness. Heart, mind/intellect, sharpness/acuteness of mind.
data.sentence: The word وَأَفْئِدَتُهُمْ comes from the root ف ا د and is associated with the meanings: to hurt in the heart, be affected with heart disease, be struck in the heart. Motion, putting in motion When said of fuel; It burned, burned up, burned brightly or fiercely, blazed, or flamed: and so when said of the heart; It became excited with ardour, or eagerness. Heart, mind/intellect, sharpness/acuteness of mind.

data.meanings: to fall steep as a bird to its prey, rev, perish, pull down, destroy, disappear, yearn, fancy, beguile, infatuate, be blown, inspire with low passion.
data.sentence: The word هَوَاءٌ comes from the root ه و ي and is associated with the meanings: to fall steep as a bird to its prey, rev, perish, pull down, destroy, disappear, yearn, fancy, beguile, infatuate, be blown, inspire with low passion.
